sentences.english: The old lady came tottering out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 老太太顫巍巍地走出屋來。

sentences.english: It took China Yida one year to construct this park, which is in the middle of rugged mountains.
sentences.chinese: 就一年時間億達公司就在巍巍的羣山中建成這個營地。

sentences.english: Then each trembling newbie had to come up to the front and briefly introduce themselves.
sentences.chinese: 然後每個人都要顫巍巍的走到最前面去做自我介紹。

sentences.english: The lofty peaks tower into the clouds.
The lofty pagoda stands like a giant at the top of the mountain.
The majestic Rocky Mountains stretch all the way from Mexico to the Arctic.
sentences.chinese: 巍巍的落基山脈南起墨西哥一直向北延伸到北極圈。

sentences.english: His speech was difficult to understand, his signature shaky and unrecognizable.
sentences.chinese: 他的演說很難聽懂，他的簽名顫顫巍巍地無法識別。

sentences.english: Then the grandmother trundled up, wailing with joy.
sentences.chinese: 然後祖母顫巍巍走來，高興地嗚咽着。

sentences.english: She was perched on a tall narrow stool.
sentences.chinese: 她顫顫巍巍地坐在一張又高又窄的凳子上。

sentences.english: It sounds like my neighbor Weiwei.
In long shaky strokes Sargent copied the data.
sentences.chinese: 薩金特用長而顫巍巍的筆畫抄錄了數據。

sentences.english: She pulled herself unsteadily from the bed to the dresser.
sentences.chinese: 她顫巍巍地由牀邊挪到梳妝檯前。

sentences.english: And all the trembling flowers they bear.
sentences.chinese: 顫巍巍的花朵綴滿枝頭上。

sentences.english: Lofty Kunlun Mountains, the ancestor of mountains, Chinese culture is originates this saint territory.
sentences.chinese: 巍巍崑崙，萬山之祖，乃華夏文化發祥聖域。

sentences.english: He rose unsteadily to his feet to question the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他顫顫巍巍地站了起來向主席提出疑問。

sentences.english: Rocky Mountains stretch all the way from Mexico to the Arctic.
sentences.chinese: 巍巍的落基山脈南起墨西哥一直向北延伸到北極圈。

definition: the peaks of a mountain range
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
evergreen pine and cypress (idiom); steadfast nobility
to stretch in an unbroken chain (esp. of mountains)
to rise steeply from level ground
lit. where tigers crouch and dragons coil (idiom); fig. forbidding terrain
